definition[0]: third in place, degree, or order
definition[1]: tertiary industries or companies are involved in providing services, rather than the production of RAW MATERIALs (=materials used in manufacturing) or manufacturing
example[0]: The government plans to transform the current farm-based rural economy into a mixture of primary, secondary and tertiary industries.
